text: Mr. Gaitskell said that a member of an alliance could not deny facilities to nations to which it was allied. But governments should be free to negotiate and refuse proposals with which they did not agree. The Labour Party opposed Thor missiles, because, he said, they were out of date and vulnerable and would attract enemy action.
handwritten_text: Mr. Gaitskell said that a member of an alliance could not deny facilities to nations to which it was allied. But governments should be free to negotiate and refuse proposals with which they did not agree. The Labour Party opposed Thor missiles, because, he said, they were out of date and vulnerable and would attract enemy action.
